commit_message:
Support volume_type as a BDM parameter when boot instances

Currently in create server API, using block_device_mapping
parameter can create cinder volume and attach to instance, but there
aren't volume type parameter to create a SLA based volume, so
this spec will add the volume type to create api.

Change-Id: I335475ec840a381c3eecfd59ce7a49cc1045673d
bp: add-volume-type-when-boot-instances

subject: Specify that unknown arguments can be passed to fetch_token
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-10-10 07:44:59.000000000', 'files': ['keystonemiddleware/fixture.py', 'keystonemiddleware/tests/unit/auth_token/test_base_middleware.py', 'keystonemiddleware/auth_token/__init__.py'], 'message': "Specify that unknown arguments can be passed to fetch_token

To allow flags to be added to fetch_token we need to ensure that any
implementations understand that new information can be passed via the
fetch_token function and that they should ignore this information if
they don't know how to handle it.

This just codifies this information for the equivalent keystone change.

Note that the default implementation of fetch_token in AuthProtocol has
not been updated as it should know of all flags that could be passed to
it.

Implements bp: allow-expired
Change-Id: I7312beb7cdd9527d959d6b7a94c6bfc6bf3c5952
"}]
commit_message:
Specify that unknown arguments can be passed to fetch_token

To allow flags to be added to fetch_token we need to ensure that any
implementations understand that new information can be passed via the
fetch_token function and that they should ignore this information if
they don't know how to handle it.

This just codifies this information for the equivalent keystone change.

Note that the default implementation of fetch_token in AuthProtocol has
not been updated as it should know of all flags that could be passed to
it.

Implements bp: allow-expired
Change-Id: I7312beb7cdd9527d959d6b7a94c6bfc6bf3c5952

commit_message:
Downloads templates from swift before processing update

There is an issue with update that the templates files need
to be downloaded before being sent to heat. This solves the issue
on the update side.

Change-Id: I8aa6262716534dec7b51e64f491d7131c359f802
Depends-On: Ib644185f2459e1705267a4114d97cf077ebfa884
Closes-Bug: #1626128

commit_message:
Add MTU configuraion when plugging vip or network

MTU must be set properly because if the tenant network is some kind
of tunnels, the default mtu may cause packets loss.

Change-Id: Ife10cb8b5ad8e5066f2e7a1565ad72a3e1916688
Closes-Bug: #1627687

commit_message:
Remove the sample policy file

The sample file has been empty for a little while now since default
policies are registered in code. Shipping an empty file may be
confusing, so let's remove it. A README has been added explaining how to
generate an actual sample policy file.

Change-Id: I23c934d2b610a451d6ebbd4276721c455365cedc
Depends-On: I85a251376dfe38caa4b100861bf764014a98bc37

commit_message:
[api] remove `user_id` and `project_id` from policy

There is no user ID and project ID support for the /v3/policy
APIs. The schema [1] validates this.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/policy/schema.py

Change-Id: I53197412c60513756bce42089f5e959d6c9a7c34
Closes-Bug: #1448602

subject: Fix grafana build steps, remove godep requirement
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-11 12:26:57.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Fix grafana build steps, remove godep requirement

Grafana use now vendor folder instead of Godeps/_workspace.
Go 1.7 use dependencies from this folder by default so now we can use
standard `go run build.go build` instead of using godep tool.

Change-Id: I2faa7a8b632a935d3381c5e9ff44762804a73b20
'}]
commit_message:
Fix grafana build steps, remove godep requirement

Grafana use now vendor folder instead of Godeps/_workspace.
Go 1.7 use dependencies from this folder by default so now we can use
standard `go run build.go build` instead of using godep tool.

Change-Id: I2faa7a8b632a935d3381c5e9ff44762804a73b20

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-04 15:43:31.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "refresh instances_path when shared storage used

When doing Live migration with shared storage, it happens erratically,

does not immediately sees the new content of the folder. This delay
could take up to 30s.

commit_message:
refresh instances_path when shared storage used

When doing Live migration with shared storage, it happens erratically,
that the check for the shared storage test_file fails. Because the shared
volume is under heavy IO (many instances on many compute nodes) the client
does not immediately sees the new content of the folder. This delay
could take up to 30s.
This can be fixed if the client is forced to refresh the directories
content, which can be achieved by 'touch' on the directory. Doing so,
the test_file is visibile instantly, within ms.
The patch adds a 'touch' on instances_path in check_shared_storage_test_file,
before checking the existence of the file.

Change-Id: I16be39142278517f43e6eca3441a56cbc9561113
Closes-Bug: #1617299
(cherry picked from commit 1af73d1fb3169c5b3cce77d94316922496bbaf9a)

commit_message:
Add error handling for delete-volume API

Due to lack of an error handling, delete-volume API returns HTTP500
error when deleting an attached volume.
This patch adds the error handling.

The corresponding Tempest test is Idb6267be770bcf2541595babebf269cdc71c2b8d

Closes-Bug: #1630783
Change-Id: Ia07556b2dc18678baa4c8fbd65820d8047362ef9
(cherry picked from commit 2afc4e466958b19a4cbb9147abb69f54a06bd507)

subject: Allow linear packing of cores
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 8768, 'name': 'Chris Friesen', 'email': 'chris.friesen@windriver.com', 'username': 'cbf123'}, {'_account_id': 8802, 'name': 'Vladik Romanovsky', 'email': 'vromanso@redhat.com', 'username': 'vladikr'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-21 08:32:38.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/test_hardware.py', 'nova/virt/hardware.py'], 'message': "Allow linear packing of cores

Given the following single-socket, four-core, HT-enabled CPU topology:

   +---+---+ +---+---+ +---+---+ +---+---+
   | x | x | | x |   | | x |   | |   |   |
   +---+---+ +---+---+ +---+---+ +---+---+
     1   4     2   5     3   6     4   7

Attempting to boot an instance with four cores and no explicit
'cpu_thread_policy' should be successful, with cores 5,6,4,7 used.
However, the current implementation of this implicit policy attempts to
fit the same number of instance cores onto each host CPU. For example,
a four core instance would result in either a 2*2 layout (two instance
cores on each of two host CPUs), or a 1*4 layout (one instance core on
each of four host CPUs). This may be correct behavior *where possible*,
but if this is not possible then any and all cores should be used.

Resolve this issue by adding a fallthrough case, whereby if the
standard fitting policy fails, a linear assignment is used to properly
fit the instance cores.

Change-Id: I73f7f771b7514060f1f74066e3dea1da8fe74c21
Closes-Bug: #1578155
(cherry picked from commit 8361d8d6c315bb3ae71c3ff0147f7d5156bc46f3)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow linear packing of cores

Given the following single-socket, four-core, HT-enabled CPU topology:

   +---+---+ +---+---+ +---+---+ +---+---+
   | x | x | | x |   | | x |   | |   |   |
   +---+---+ +---+---+ +---+---+ +---+---+
     1   4     2   5     3   6     4   7

Attempting to boot an instance with four cores and no explicit
'cpu_thread_policy' should be successful, with cores 5,6,4,7 used.
However, the current implementation of this implicit policy attempts to
fit the same number of instance cores onto each host CPU. For example,
a four core instance would result in either a 2*2 layout (two instance
cores on each of two host CPUs), or a 1*4 layout (one instance core on
each of four host CPUs). This may be correct behavior *where possible*,
but if this is not possible then any and all cores should be used.

Resolve this issue by adding a fallthrough case, whereby if the
standard fitting policy fails, a linear assignment is used to properly
fit the instance cores.

Change-Id: I73f7f771b7514060f1f74066e3dea1da8fe74c21
Closes-Bug: #1578155
(cherry picked from commit 8361d8d6c315bb3ae71c3ff0147f7d5156bc46f3)

commit_message:
Merge Postgresql service modules

Postgresql has been implemented differently from
all other guest agents.
This has been causing difficulties with maintenance
and future development of Trove design.
It has been decided (Newton midcycle) to bring the guest agent
in line with others.

This patch set merges all Postgres service modules into
App/Admin classes.

This also resolves 20 pylint issues related to mixin usage.

Change-Id: I1b12a5296c59e9d3b08bcf34ac196d16189d525e

subject: Move management code to inventory lib.
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-10-11 19:16:24.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_manage.py', 'lib/manage.py', 'lib/__init__.py', 'tox.ini', 'scripts/inventory-manage.py'], 'message': 'Move management code to inventory lib.

This change moves the management code into a library file for
consolidated access to the code. Nothing is changed with the interface
to the inventory-manage script.

The lib/__init__.py file is necessary for python to
import the lib directory as a package, which will become more important
as more code is relocated there.

The code was originally moved to playbooks/inventory/lib, but doing so
made Ansible try to run the python files, which they intentionally will
not do.

Change-Id: I2e31927ec48022c7a504096780977319882c6bdf
'}]
commit_message:
Move management code to inventory lib.

This change moves the management code into a library file for
consolidated access to the code. Nothing is changed with the interface
to the inventory-manage script.

The lib/__init__.py file is necessary for python to
import the lib directory as a package, which will become more important
as more code is relocated there.

The code was originally moved to playbooks/inventory/lib, but doing so
made Ansible try to run the python files, which they intentionally will
not do.

Change-Id: I2e31927ec48022c7a504096780977319882c6bdf

commit_message:
Add the note of maximum microversion

On the gate, we are limiting each maximum microversion for stable
branches (Please see Id7ad136a4d79992e9df8d1aa463aff8fc58579ab as
the reference). For doing that, we are checking each project maximum
microversion for each release.
This additional note will help us, and the format is the same as
Nova's rest_api_version_history.rst.
In addition, this patch fixes some weird rst format.

Change-Id: I0f802fb4af5ded6186ab81ad28804b84824716e3

commit_message:
Bump ironic-lib version to 2.2.0

This patch is bumping the ironic-lib version to 2.2.0. This version
includes features and fixes some high priority bugs which includes but
is not limited to:

* Fix creating config drive for whole disk images
* Add support for operators in root device hints

commit_message:
Make UpdateManager use a passed-in stack setup

With the use of plans and Mistral, we can use the ProcessTemplatesAction,
which returns a ready-made set of Heat parameters. This simplifies the
update dramatically, and helps to make the client work again.

Change-Id: Ib644185f2459e1705267a4114d97cf077ebfa884
(cherry picked from commit e292c04d4192f1cc940c69ac2ace0418c423a7f0)

commit_message:
WIP: Common shared state scheduler

This spec proposes an idea for an alternative memory model for the
scheduler that can allow for more horizontal scaling of the scheduler
while still reducing retry failures.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-01 18:43:23.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/db/api.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Preserve legacy db api attachment_get_by calls

We fixed up the volume_attachment_get_by_* calls to
behave as expected and gave them new names that
match what they actually do.  There is however
a possibility that this could cause issues with
rolling upgrades.   It's possible that there could
be a situation where the controller has been upgraded
but the c-vol service is still running the old version.

The result would be that attach calls in that scenario
would fail because the old methods aren't there any
longer.

This patch puts the legacy calls back in and we can then
remove them after the next release.

Change-Id: I6e5cd8218f31a7d06f0c56c7a873a0ad01c92548
Related-Bug: #1585690
"}]
commit_message:
Preserve legacy db api attachment_get_by calls

We fixed up the volume_attachment_get_by_* calls to
behave as expected and gave them new names that
match what they actually do.  There is however
a possibility that this could cause issues with
rolling upgrades.   It's possible that there could
be a situation where the controller has been upgraded
but the c-vol service is still running the old version.

The result would be that attach calls in that scenario
would fail because the old methods aren't there any
longer.

This patch puts the legacy calls back in and we can then
remove them after the next release.

Change-Id: I6e5cd8218f31a7d06f0c56c7a873a0ad01c92548
Related-Bug: #1585690

commit_message:
Fix to run functional tests

After the scenario test merge [1] our functional tests were no longer
being run by the py* tests.  This patch adds a functional test
environment and updates the cover environment to include the
functional test coverage.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/172199

Change-Id: If6b1de66ed441e0c05cc8daf640b6e713d7e0708
Closes-Bug: #1630012

commit_message:
Fix code for new pep8 rules

This change updates the code to comply with a new pep8 rule to defer the
string concatenation to the logger instead of doing it inline.

It also adds an ignore rule for conf options being outside of nova.conf.
Given that we are an out-of-tree driver, we can not put our conf options
in tree.  This is a temporary work around until the powervm driver is in
tree.

Change-Id: I8fe77e8250a2b59ae842cdacfa48baf66356ee50
Closes-Bug: #1632441

commit_message:
Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert

Some of tests use different method of
assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) or assertEqual(type(A), B).
The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A, B) provided
by testtools

Change-Id: Ic741b987fa184b9e9efb22750b8d8245c6c62676

commit_message:
Propose Thierry Carrez as TC chair for Ocata

I'd like to nominate myself to be the chair of the
Technical Committee for yet one more round. Since Doug
is still holding the PTLship for release management,
I have extra time to dedicate to the Technical Committee,
which comes handy to navigate the complex issues we need
to tackle in the near future.

Change-Id: I4bd9db2153e2ccd4873554508399fd2a02be889e

commit_message:
Use UCA for keepalived by default

This should have been done long ago. Currently, the ppa is used,
because it's more up to date than Ubuntu Cloud Archive. However,
ubuntu cloud archive is the default in other roles, so we should
stick to the same method.

Change-Id: If10b5bdee977a8479934afb905145336d1094faa
Closes-Bug: 1617387

commit_message:
Enable release notes translation

Releasenote translation publishing is being prepared. 'locale_dirs'
needs to be defined in conf.py to generate translated version of the
release notes.

Note that this repository might not get translated release notes - or
no translations at all - but we add the entry here nevertheless to
prepare for it.

Change-Id: I6d9eac9c512935a728f3d3919b1ac2f560efe403

commit_message:
Simplify governance website title

Currently governance.o.o displays the following HTML title:
"OpenStack Technical Committee Governance Documents -- OpenStack
Governance 2014.1.0.dev1713 documentation".

This change simplifies it and removes the odd version number.
Removes upper copyright year while we are at it.

Change-Id: I0487e6d6ed6ac55ff782cb197943a521eb91771e

commit_message:
collector: do not set any dispatcher by default

This changes remove database as the default dispatcher so we stop
shipping a default that we don't recommend.

Change-Id: Idf2f171c4dabbee78308b0fbabeeaa541b782b66

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-10-04 23:41:03.000000000', 'files': ['specs/keystone/ocata/allow-expired.rst', 'attic/v3/identity-api-v3.rst'], 'message': 'Allow retrieving an expired token

When a service token is present on a token validation request we should
trust that this token was already validated by that service and ignore
the expiry time. This will allow long running operations involving
service to service communication to complete.

Implements bp: allow-expired
Change-Id: Ib1908747ebc7c4be5aafa40039b38ca8ece88ccd
'}]
commit_message:
Allow retrieving an expired token

When a service token is present on a token validation request we should
trust that this token was already validated by that service and ignore
the expiry time. This will allow long running operations involving
service to service communication to complete.

Implements bp: allow-expired
Change-Id: Ib1908747ebc7c4be5aafa40039b38ca8ece88ccd

commit_message:
TrivialFix: Remove default=None when set value in Config

By default oslo.cfg sets the default values as None [1], There is
no need to explicitly do this.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/blob/master/oslo_config/cfg.py#L829

Change-Id: If51508b034a78cb4b881e7cb9a77cd1d347c8e1e

So add the following hacking rule for it.

Closes-Bug: #1596829
'}]
commit_message:
Add a hacking rule for string interpolation at logging

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled
by the logging code, rather than being done
at the point of the logging call.
So add the following hacking rule for it.

- [N354] String interpolation should be delayed at logging calls.

See the oslo i18n guideline.

* http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

Change-Id: Ief6d3ee3539c0857098fffdb7acfeec3e0fed6eb
Closes-Bug: #1596829

subject: Don't use cast() to do StackResource delete
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-22 14:06:55.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_nested_stack.py', 'heat/tests/test_provider_template.py', 'heat/engine/resources/stack_resource.py', 'heat/tests/test_stack_resource.py'], 'message': "Don't use cast() to do StackResource delete

If an exception was raised in delete_stack when deleting a nested stack,
the parent stack would never hear about it because we were accidentally
using cast() instead of call() to do the stack delete. This meant the
parent resource would remain DELETE_IN_PROGRESS until timeout when the
nested stack had already failed and raised an exception.

In the case of bug 1499669, the exception being missed was
StopActionFailed.

Change-Id: I039eb8f6c6a262653c1e9edc8173e5680d81e31b
Partial-Bug: #1499669
(cherry picked from commit e5cec71e52c3fed0ffb4385990758db8ebf367da)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use cast() to do StackResource delete

If an exception was raised in delete_stack when deleting a nested stack,
the parent stack would never hear about it because we were accidentally
using cast() instead of call() to do the stack delete. This meant the
parent resource would remain DELETE_IN_PROGRESS until timeout when the
nested stack had already failed and raised an exception.

In the case of bug 1499669, the exception being missed was
StopActionFailed.

Change-Id: I039eb8f6c6a262653c1e9edc8173e5680d81e31b
Partial-Bug: #1499669
(cherry picked from commit e5cec71e52c3fed0ffb4385990758db8ebf367da)

subject: Actually start the systemd services in step3 of the major-upgrade step
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-11 10:26:23.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_controller_pacemaker_3.sh'], 'message': 'Actually start the systemd services in step3 of the major-upgrade step

We have the following function in the upgrade process after we updated
the packages and called the db-sync commands:
services=$(services_to_migrate)
...
for service in $(services); do
    manage_systemd_service start "${service%%-clone}"
    check_resource_systemd "${service%%-clone}" started 600
done

The above is broken because $services contains a list of services to
start, so $(services) will return gibberish and the for loop will never
execute anything.

One of the symptoms for this is the openstack-nova-compute service not
restarting on the compute nodes during the yum -y upgrade. The reason
for this is that during the service restart, nova-compute waits for
nova-conductor to show up in the rabbitmq queues, which cannot happen
since the service was actually never started.

Change-Id: I811ff19d7b44a935b2ec5c5e66e5b5191b259eb3
Closes-Bug: #1630580
(cherry picked from commit 30a570a7f461a4c4411d9cde67d8de9042952016)
'}]
commit_message:
Actually start the systemd services in step3 of the major-upgrade step

We have the following function in the upgrade process after we updated
the packages and called the db-sync commands:
services=$(services_to_migrate)
...
for service in $(services); do
    manage_systemd_service start "${service%%-clone}"
    check_resource_systemd "${service%%-clone}" started 600
done

The above is broken because $services contains a list of services to
start, so $(services) will return gibberish and the for loop will never
execute anything.

One of the symptoms for this is the openstack-nova-compute service not
restarting on the compute nodes during the yum -y upgrade. The reason
for this is that during the service restart, nova-compute waits for
nova-conductor to show up in the rabbitmq queues, which cannot happen
since the service was actually never started.

Change-Id: I811ff19d7b44a935b2ec5c5e66e5b5191b259eb3
Closes-Bug: #1630580
(cherry picked from commit 30a570a7f461a4c4411d9cde67d8de9042952016)

The vmware-nsxlib in an infrastructure package for the vmware-nsx
and other vmware projects in teh future.

Here is fist adding package Q&A:
[Q]Is the library actively maintained?
[A]Yes, vmware neutron team will actively maintain this repo.

[Q]Is the library good code?
[A]Yes.

[Q]Is the library python 3 compatible?
[A]Yes.

[Q]Is the library license compatible?
[A]Yes.

[Q]Is the library already packaged in the distros we target
   (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?
[A]No.[WIP]

[Q]Is the function of this library already covered by other
   libraries in global-requirements.txt?
[A]No. This code was pulled out of vmware-nsx in patch
   Ief8af0d5cad8223fb52313d26d75c1f10b13c3cf

   or infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes,

Change-Id: I6a0560670634853ba72791dc1d1732f05377b158
'}]
commit_message:
Add first release of vmware-nsxlib as min version

The vmware-nsxlib in an infrastructure package for the vmware-nsx
and other vmware projects in teh future.

Here is fist adding package Q&A:
[Q]Is the library actively maintained?
[A]Yes, vmware neutron team will actively maintain this repo.

[Q]Is the library good code?
[A]Yes.

[Q]Is the library python 3 compatible?
[A]Yes.

[Q]Is the library license compatible?
[A]Yes.

[Q]Is the library already packaged in the distros we target
   (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?
[A]No.[WIP]

[Q]Is the function of this library already covered by other
   libraries in global-requirements.txt?
[A]No. This code was pulled out of vmware-nsx in patch
   Ief8af0d5cad8223fb52313d26d75c1f10b13c3cf

[Q]Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev
   or infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes,
   of course) Which?
[A]Yes, only vmware-nsx now.

Change-Id: I6a0560670634853ba72791dc1d1732f05377b158

subject: Change batch listener to default 'blocking'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-29 05:32:46.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/messaging.py'], 'message': "Change batch listener to default 'blocking'

With 'threading' executor, ceilometer-collector wants to consume all
messages before dispatching them. With large numbers of messages in
queue it very quickly runs out of memory.

Changing it to the default 'blocking' makes it to dispatch messages
before consuming more.

Closes-Bug: #1551667
Change-Id: I496ed874a11e961c6e0bca3ebc93d0d422760d8b
"}]
commit_message:
Change batch listener to default 'blocking'

With 'threading' executor, ceilometer-collector wants to consume all
messages before dispatching them. With large numbers of messages in
queue it very quickly runs out of memory.

Changing it to the default 'blocking' makes it to dispatch messages
before consuming more.

Closes-Bug: #1551667
Change-Id: I496ed874a11e961c6e0bca3ebc93d0d422760d8b

commit_message:
Replace OVSSfcAgent by a L2 agent extension

Currently the OVSSfcAgent inherits from OVSNeutronAgent in order to
reuse its code. This commit replaces it by a L2 agent extension.

The L2 agent extension handles generic code, and dispatches specific
code to driver modules.

The only supported driver currently is Open vSwitch.

This is enabled by adding sfc to agent->extensions configuration
parameter in ml2_conf.ini

Change-Id: I6bd4fd80e312d48287b2bc7b44e3cdcdf3bdf508
Closes-Bug: #1586024

release notes.

Note that this repository might not get translated release notes - or
no translations at all - but we add the entry here nevertheless to
prepare for it.

Change-Id: Idce1386c53d287f33a1050d2f2e175ca1a7c40df

commit_message:
Fixes unit test config override

Some of the tests were failing due to improper configuration overrides
in the test cases.  This patch fixes those tests to use the current
recommended method with oslo test fixtures that will cleanup after the
test.

Change-Id: I5f1ea16bbc16056aa756415a618a8f4192436dfd
Closes-Bug: #1630060

subject: Fix revert on 404 from amphora agent startup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-07 21:19:25.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/amphorae/drivers/haproxy/rest_api_driver.py'], 'message': 'Fix revert on 404 from amphora agent startup

When the amphora agent is starting up, it will return 404 until
the startup is complete.  This patch adds one retry when the driver
receives a 404 back from the agent to allow time for it to finish
starting.

Change-Id: Idcf666dc508d77fb1eb1d46acdaa1b4afa278b8c
Closes-Bug: #1631525
'}]
commit_message:
Fix revert on 404 from amphora agent startup

When the amphora agent is starting up, it will return 404 until
the startup is complete.  This patch adds one retry when the driver
receives a 404 back from the agent to allow time for it to finish
starting.

Change-Id: Idcf666dc508d77fb1eb1d46acdaa1b4afa278b8c
Closes-Bug: #1631525

subject: Add newline to ceph.conf created from ceph_conf_file
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-11 08:52:56.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/ceph_config.yml'], 'message': 'Add newline to ceph.conf created from ceph_conf_file

Without a newline at the end of ceph.conf ceph clients complain about
config file parsing errors.

Two \n are required because ansible strips off the first one when
setting the fact.

Change-Id: I0cfe451af347ef280c09262f53973887694ced0a
'}]
commit_message:
Add newline to ceph.conf created from ceph_conf_file

Without a newline at the end of ceph.conf ceph clients complain about
config file parsing errors.

Two \n are required because ansible strips off the first one when
setting the fact.

Change-Id: I0cfe451af347ef280c09262f53973887694ced0a

commit_message:

MTU has been changed in neutron to 1450 by default by [0]
As result ISCSI job on xenial become broken. This patch
decreases MTU on br-ex to 1450.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/commit/51a697817da849c8f9dae9651f17cd863e170fdc

Related-Bug: #1631875
Related-Bug: #1603268
Change-Id: Idb12dab4f7815e59fc8f3a683a179f74de801e6a

commit_message:
Fix glance_api_servers variable

The glance_api_servers variable is used by ironic and was setup
incorrectly.
We should also set the cinder_glance_api_servers setting and the
nova_glance_api_servers variables to match this variable.

Change-Id: I5ac251bd24c735986fa654b1aa723ed2aae6a03b

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-10-11 12:05:18.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ironic', 'devstack/tools/ironic/scripts/setup-network.sh', 'devstack/settings'], 'message': 'Fix broken xenial job

MTU has been changed in neutron to 1450 by default by [0]
As result ISCSI job on xenial become broken. With this patch
PUBLIC_BRIDGE_MTU is set to smallest mtu of existed interfaces decreased
by 50. MTU on IRONIC_VM_NETWORK_BRIDGE is set to PUBLIC_BRIDGE_MTU.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/commit/51a697817da849c8f9dae9651f17cd863e170fdc

Closes-Bug: #1631875
Related-Bug: #1603268
Change-Id: I044d415410a714591e9770a57cfb8509a103cf00
'}]
commit_message:
Fix broken xenial job

MTU has been changed in neutron to 1450 by default by [0]
As result ISCSI job on xenial become broken. With this patch
PUBLIC_BRIDGE_MTU is set to smallest mtu of existed interfaces decreased
by 50. MTU on IRONIC_VM_NETWORK_BRIDGE is set to PUBLIC_BRIDGE_MTU.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/commit/51a697817da849c8f9dae9651f17cd863e170fdc

Closes-Bug: #1631875
Related-Bug: #1603268
Change-Id: I044d415410a714591e9770a57cfb8509a103cf00

[{'number': 25, 'created': '2016-10-11 13:45:15.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lib/api/validators.py', 'neutron_lib/tests/unit/api/test_validators.py'], 'message': "Enhance valid_values to use __contains__

Actually valid_values doesn't cover many of the use cases or validates
that the value and valid_values provided can be used with 'in' call.

his patch tries to improve this situation to ensure that both are valid
for being checked or fail otherwise plus validating that valid_values

Closes-Bug: 1604073
Change-Id: I47a6f7d58d6cbeb8fd245620d187c4c565497290

commit_message:
Enhance valid_values to use __contains__

Actually valid_values doesn't cover many of the use cases or validates
that the value and valid_values provided can be used with 'in' call.

his patch tries to improve this situation to ensure that both are valid
for being checked or fail otherwise plus validating that valid_values
contains the value provided.

Closes-Bug: 1604073

commit_message:
Move qemu-img installation after repo setup

Move qemu-img after setting up the repos. Nova depends on a version
that conflics with the one installed for setting up images before
deploying.
Moving install after repo ensure we install the version nova would
install as dependency anyway

Change-Id: Iee9a8553abdaeb67816e3242a856108f95fcab4d
Closes-Bug: #1631929

commit_message:
Use new 'apply-config' to apply oac data

This patch updates all of t-h-t so that we use the new
heat-config-apply-config hook. This hooks supports more Heat
signalling transports than we support with the old 99-refresh-completed.

This will be required in order to use the composable services for
new installer types like the new t-h-t driven undercloud installer.

Partially-implements: blueprint heat-undercloud

Change-Id: Ib0417d163971f3641973b7b5fc73e08a0df061bd
Depends-On: I7b8a6823a246c4649b1fc5bf2c51d3e282f20a39

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2016-10-09 12:27:35.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/hot/functions.py', 'doc/source/template_guide/hot_spec.rst', 'heat/engine/hot/template.py', 'heat/tests/test_hot.py'], 'message': 'add list_concat and list_unique intrinsinc functions

Add two new intrinsic functions to heat.  list_concat simply
concatenates all the sublists:

    list_concat: [[1,2,3], [3,4,5]] -> [1,2,3,3,4,5]

While list_unique will create a list of unique items from all the
sublists:

    list_unique: [[1,2,3], [3,4,5]] -> [1,3,5,4,2]

list_unique does not preserve the ordering of the items.

bp hot-template-list-merge
Change-Id: Iceda93c0e1b3ae015f0888fb985652928deb94af
'}]
commit_message:
add list_concat and list_unique intrinsinc functions

Add two new intrinsic functions to heat.  list_concat simply
concatenates all the sublists:

    list_concat: [[1,2,3], [3,4,5]] -> [1,2,3,3,4,5]

While list_unique will create a list of unique items from all the
sublists:

    list_unique: [[1,2,3], [3,4,5]] -> [1,3,5,4,2]

list_unique does not preserve the ordering of the items.

bp hot-template-list-merge
Change-Id: Iceda93c0e1b3ae015f0888fb985652928deb94af

commit_message:
Add prefix vars to add options for lxc_build

Ansible doesn't have role scoped include_vars. Adding
lxc_hosts_pip_install_options for the pip install build on centos and
allow override with pip_install_options for other roles.

Change-Id: I78fb85d44b5b0e1643bd07af3e15462c02041c89

commit_message:
Add swap volume notifications (start, end)

Add the following notifications when swapping volumes.

* 'instance.volume_swap.start'
* 'instance.volume_swap.end'

A subsequent patch will add 'instance.volume_swap.error'.

Change-Id: Ic4d9d25bdc611221157e4663817e918b8d667ce9
Implements: blueprint add-swap-volume-notifications

subject: Libvirt: Use the virtlogd deamon
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-10-11 15:43:56.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ocata/approved/libvirt-virtlogd.rst'], 'message': 'Libvirt: Use the virtlogd deamon

If the *serial console* feature is enabled on a compute node with
``[serial_console].enabled = True`` it deactivates the logging of the
boot messages. From a REST API perspective, this means that the two
APIs ``os-getConsoleOutput`` and ``os-getSerialConsole`` are mutually
exclusive. Both APIs can be valuable for cloud operators in the case
when something goes wrong during the launch of an instance. This
blueprint wants to lift the XOR relationship between those two REST
APIs.

Bug 1599214 in Qemu made it necessary to block the usage of "virtlogd"
in Newton. Qemu 2.7.0 fixes the aforementioned issue which makes a
re-proposal of this formerly approved spec possible. This change updates
the Qemu version requirement.

Previously-approved: Newton
blueprint libvirt-virtlogd
Change-Id: Ia97c3fd6023687ee4b7903a0f8b30716677b10dd
'}]
commit_message:
Libvirt: Use the virtlogd deamon

If the *serial console* feature is enabled on a compute node with
``[serial_console].enabled = True`` it deactivates the logging of the
boot messages. From a REST API perspective, this means that the two
APIs ``os-getConsoleOutput`` and ``os-getSerialConsole`` are mutually
exclusive. Both APIs can be valuable for cloud operators in the case
when something goes wrong during the launch of an instance. This
blueprint wants to lift the XOR relationship between those two REST
APIs.

Bug 1599214 in Qemu made it necessary to block the usage of "virtlogd"
in Newton. Qemu 2.7.0 fixes the aforementioned issue which makes a
re-proposal of this formerly approved spec possible. This change updates
the Qemu version requirement.

Previously-approved: Newton
blueprint libvirt-virtlogd

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-10-07 18:18:17.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/tests/test_update.py', 'tripleo_common/update.py'], 'message': 'Make UpdateManager use a passed-in stack setup

With the use of plans and Mistral, we can use the ProcessTemplatesAction,
which returns a ready-made set of Heat parameters. This simplifies the
update dramatically, and helps to make the client work again.

Change-Id: Ib644185f2459e1705267a4114d97cf077ebfa884
'}]
commit_message:
Make UpdateManager use a passed-in stack setup

With the use of plans and Mistral, we can use the ProcessTemplatesAction,
which returns a ready-made set of Heat parameters. This simplifies the
update dramatically, and helps to make the client work again.

Change-Id: Ib644185f2459e1705267a4114d97cf077ebfa884

commit_message:
Release Neutron 8.3.0 (mitaka)

This change introduced a new configuration option
(ha_keepalived_state_change_server_threads) hence the minor version
bump.

It should be the last Mitaka release that was prepared by rules of Phase
I of stable branch maintenance guidelines:
http://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#support-phases

Avoid tagging for vpnaas and fwaas because those repositories did not
get any updates since previous release.

Change-Id: Id85d0e0d195f6771bf9bc7b34ed437cc8c472a90

commit_message:
Populate vnc_api_lib.ini on compute nodes with OpenContrail

This is setting sane defaults for vnc_api_lib.ini as requested from the
field. The settings still can be overriden using NovaComputeExtraConfig
if needed.

Right now, HAProxy only terminates the public endpoints. This change
makes haproxy also terminate the internal/admin ones. Subsequently,
HAProxy will be always used in order to have a deployment more
similar to the overcloud.

Change-Id: Ib6469f8e4b62ca2aba5720a369a0a5ac7fcee6b6
'}]
commit_message:
Make HAProxy terminate OpenStack internal/admin endpoints

Right now, HAProxy only terminates the public endpoints. This change
makes haproxy also terminate the internal/admin ones. Subsequently,
HAProxy will be always used in order to have a deployment more
similar to the overcloud.

Change-Id: Ib6469f8e4b62ca2aba5720a369a0a5ac7fcee6b6

therefore monasca-client should allow to
query statistic with it.

commit_message:
Log node state transitions at INFO level

State transitions are extremely important for understanding what is happening
to a node, so by the guidelines it makes sense to log them as INFO.

Change-Id: Ib2fff7040778b93cb7d4562ff00c459e5141c6b9

commit_message:
Minor release notes fix

* Render nested lists properly (A blank line is required
  when a nested list starts)
* Add a launchpad link for a bug
* Add periods for better readability
* URL only release note looks unusual. The bug link (bug 1508571) is
  actually described in the feature section, so the URL was moved.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I1240c325207bbca513b2e41cc02065118797c2c4

subject: Enable release notes translation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-06 18:44:20.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/source/conf.py'], 'message': "Enable release notes translation

Releasenote translation publishing is being prepared. 'locale_dirs'
needs to be defined in conf.py to generate translated version of the
release notes.

Note that this repository might not get translated release notes - or
no translations at all - but we add the entry here nevertheless to
prepare for it.

Change-Id: I5a6becae61db9d73ce1213aa854361329618dafa
"}]
commit_message:
Enable release notes translation

Releasenote translation publishing is being prepared. 'locale_dirs'
needs to be defined in conf.py to generate translated version of the
release notes.

Note that this repository might not get translated release notes - or
no translations at all - but we add the entry here nevertheless to
prepare for it.

Change-Id: I5a6becae61db9d73ce1213aa854361329618dafa

commit_message:
Switch Nova workers to '' by default

By default if you provide an empty string to the nova workers, it will
uses the number of CPUs. Since we would still like to have the numerical
validation on this value, we need to support either a valid number or ''
as the value for NovaWorkers.

Change-Id: I929355d6f4a6a028e4907d05be3a663456ea6ad4
Closes-Bug: #1631133

subject: Get rid of double-join to rbac_entries without filter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-11 07:04:39.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/common_db_mixin.py'], 'message': "Get rid of double-join to rbac_entries without filter

apply_filters_to_query was performing an outerjoin to rbac_entries
unconditionally when model_query could have already performed an
outerjoin (if the request was from an unprivileged user) and/or when
the join wasn't even necessary (the '?shared=False' query that uses
a subquery and not a join). This resulted in terrible performance
because of cartesian products of rbac entries with themselves.

This fixes the issue by ensuring there is only an outerjoin to the
rbac table if it's going to be used for a filter condition and it's
not already joined because of a query scope imposed due to the user
not being privileged.

Unfortunately this doesn't include tests to prevent regressions because
we don't have any methods for testing the performance of individual
queries.

Closes-Bug: #1630939
Change-Id: I4364f4a97a29041e86b2fbd8aa895578153f4cf9
(cherry picked from commit 145dbaab21c7b541294869eec547731a9694cbad)
"}]
commit_message:
Get rid of double-join to rbac_entries without filter

apply_filters_to_query was performing an outerjoin to rbac_entries
unconditionally when model_query could have already performed an
outerjoin (if the request was from an unprivileged user) and/or when
the join wasn't even necessary (the '?shared=False' query that uses
a subquery and not a join). This resulted in terrible performance
because of cartesian products of rbac entries with themselves.

This fixes the issue by ensuring there is only an outerjoin to the
rbac table if it's going to be used for a filter condition and it's
not already joined because of a query scope imposed due to the user
not being privileged.

Unfortunately this doesn't include tests to prevent regressions because
we don't have any methods for testing the performance of individual
queries.

Closes-Bug: #1630939
Change-Id: I4364f4a97a29041e86b2fbd8aa895578153f4cf9
(cherry picked from commit 145dbaab21c7b541294869eec547731a9694cbad)

commit_message:
Add new typos in glance code

Unfortunately the number of typos significantly
decreased in the last cycle. For this reason it's
becoming incredibly difficult to do changes in
glance, which may lead to reduction in the number
of commits in the future.

This patch fixes this unpleasant situation and adds
several new typos that can be fixed to improve your
statistics.

Change-Id: I9d4efefa2a978c46c0e5911513b2107a06ba72ab

subject: Remove paramiko dependency
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-16 13:02:40.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'nova/crypto.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_crypto.py'], 'message': "Remove paramiko dependency

In Liberty, key pair creation (previously done via ssh-keygen) was
replaced with paramiko library calls. While paramiko was listed as a
Nova dependency in Liberty, it wasn't actually used until that commit.

  Replace ssh exec calls with paramiko lib
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/157931/

The above commit was unintentionally backwards incompatible.
Specifically, it changed the SSH key ASN.1 encoding from DER to BER.
Apparently golang doesn't support BER, meaning tools like Terraform no
longer work with OpenStack.

  ssh-keygen-to-Paramiko change breaks third-party tools
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1483132

This has since been fixed in paramiko 2.0, but that major version bump
doesn't make it into Nova until Newton, meaning these third-party tools
are unusable for Liberty & Mitaka in the mean time.

   stable/liberty: paramiko>=1.13.0
   upper-constraints: paramiko===1.16.0

   stable/mitaka: paramiko>=1.16.0
   upper-constraints: paramiko===1.16.0

   master (newton): paramiko>=2.0
   upper-constraints: paramiko===2.0.2

The bump to paramiko 2.0 was a big change, complete with a huge red
warning in the changelog (which I suspect makes a backport that bumps
the paramiko version to 2.0+ unrealistic for Liberty & Mitaka).

  http://www.paramiko.org/changelog.html
  http://bitprophet.org/blog/2016/04/23/paramiko-2.0-is-coming/

The switch to paramiko also introduced a number of other Nova
regressions along the way.

  nova should accept pre-pended comments in public keys
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1613199

  Tolerate installation of pycryptodome
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/279909/

  crypto: Add support for Paramiko 2.x
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/314592/

  Drop paramiko < 2 compat code
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/314639/

All this, coupled with the known security implications of using the
older paramiko versions, makes me think that perhaps we should just go
back to using ssh-keygen.

Ideally, I'd like to backport this change all the way down to
stable/liberty.

Closes-Bug #1621536
Change-Id: Id6a9c4ec9ba3420190647dfb72b314ae9008eae7
(cherry picked from commit 1d6fc3931326fbfaeaf150a5815ea8911c335b7b)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove paramiko dependency

In Liberty, key pair creation (previously done via ssh-keygen) was
replaced with paramiko library calls. While paramiko was listed as a
Nova dependency in Liberty, it wasn't actually used until that commit.

  Replace ssh exec calls with paramiko lib
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/157931/

The above commit was unintentionally backwards incompatible.
Specifically, it changed the SSH key ASN.1 encoding from DER to BER.
Apparently golang doesn't support BER, meaning tools like Terraform no
longer work with OpenStack.

  ssh-keygen-to-Paramiko change breaks third-party tools
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1483132

This has since been fixed in paramiko 2.0, but that major version bump
doesn't make it into Nova until Newton, meaning these third-party tools
are unusable for Liberty & Mitaka in the mean time.

   stable/liberty: paramiko>=1.13.0
   upper-constraints: paramiko===1.16.0

   stable/mitaka: paramiko>=1.16.0
   upper-constraints: paramiko===1.16.0

   master (newton): paramiko>=2.0
   upper-constraints: paramiko===2.0.2

The bump to paramiko 2.0 was a big change, complete with a huge red
warning in the changelog (which I suspect makes a backport that bumps
the paramiko version to 2.0+ unrealistic for Liberty & Mitaka).

  http://www.paramiko.org/changelog.html
  http://bitprophet.org/blog/2016/04/23/paramiko-2.0-is-coming/

The switch to paramiko also introduced a number of other Nova
regressions along the way.

  nova should accept pre-pended comments in public keys
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1613199

  Tolerate installation of pycryptodome
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/279909/

  crypto: Add support for Paramiko 2.x
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/314592/

  Drop paramiko < 2 compat code
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/314639/

All this, coupled with the known security implications of using the
older paramiko versions, makes me think that perhaps we should just go
back to using ssh-keygen.

Ideally, I'd like to backport this change all the way down to
stable/liberty.

Closes-Bug #1621536
Change-Id: Id6a9c4ec9ba3420190647dfb72b314ae9008eae7
(cherry picked from commit 1d6fc3931326fbfaeaf150a5815ea8911c335b7b)

commit_message:
Fix Backup removal is not working

Argument --remove-before-date added
Argument --remove-from-date deprecated in favor of --remove-before-date
Argument --remove-before-date now accepts ISO datetime and timestamp

Closes-bug: 1599592

Conflicts:
	README.rst
	freezer/common/config.py
	freezer/job.py
	freezer/main.py
	freezer/storage/base.py
	freezer/utils.py

(cherry-picked from: I5a2c535ca4bf837cd2dc63e9e664ffc979e516bd)

Change-Id: I260fa52f404eef067d6bd0629de3690af7c37653

subject: Prefetch only messages we can handle
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-06 12:41:40.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/messaging.py'], 'message': 'Prefetch only messages we can handle

By default, oslo.messaging drivers prefetch all messages their can when
we ask for consuming one message to speed up next call. While it works well
for RPC in general because the number of messaging waiting on their queue are
always low, for our notification usage, since we have multiple workers with multiple
threads, this can consume a lot of memory.

This change sets sane oslo.messaging default for our use-cases.

Change-Id: Ic96f39a593dbca4669db79d2d5427d7e306287e3
'}]
commit_message:
Prefetch only messages we can handle

By default, oslo.messaging drivers prefetch all messages their can when
we ask for consuming one message to speed up next call. While it works well
for RPC in general because the number of messaging waiting on their queue are
always low, for our notification usage, since we have multiple workers with multiple
threads, this can consume a lot of memory.

This change sets sane oslo.messaging default for our use-cases.

Change-Id: Ic96f39a593dbca4669db79d2d5427d7e306287e3

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-10-07 08:27:13.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/cmds/__init__.py', 'oslo_log/cmds/convert_json.py', 'setup.cfg', 'oslo_log/tests/unit/test_convert_json.py'], 'message': 'Add a json reformatter command

It would save a lot of space to only write JSON logs, rather than also
write formatted logs. This utility turns the former into the latter
so we can do this without removing the ability of a sysadmin to read
logs in a sensible format.

You can either provide a filename or pipe via stdin. `tail -f` works
as stdin. Each record must occupy precisely one line.

Change-Id: I334e1e52d442f82bf68da9e581ce44bc3465208b
Co-Authored-By: Alexis Lee <lxsli@hpe.com>

commit_message:
Add a json reformatter command

It would save a lot of space to only write JSON logs, rather than also
write formatted logs. This utility turns the former into the latter
so we can do this without removing the ability of a sysadmin to read
logs in a sensible format.

You can either provide a filename or pipe via stdin. `tail -f` works
as stdin. Each record must occupy precisely one line.

Change-Id: I334e1e52d442f82bf68da9e581ce44bc3465208b
Co-Authored-By: Alexis Lee <lxsli@hpe.com>

subject: 'Forms:' section is now truly optional in ui definition
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-07 15:07:42.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/dynamic_ui/services.py'], 'message': ''Forms:' section is now truly optional in ui definition

The only mandatory section of the UI definition file is the
"Application" block which defines the input object model snippet.
Everything else is optional: the app developer may have no user input
for their app besides its name.

However, the UI was crashing if no 'Forms:' section is present. This
has been fixed.

Change-Id: Ie72770a8810369e2bff9a59e8f3845144032f080
Closes-bug: #1630672
'}]
commit_message:
'Forms:' section is now truly optional in ui definition

The only mandatory section of the UI definition file is the
"Application" block which defines the input object model snippet.
Everything else is optional: the app developer may have no user input
for their app besides its name.

However, the UI was crashing if no 'Forms:' section is present. This
has been fixed.

Change-Id: Ie72770a8810369e2bff9a59e8f3845144032f080
Closes-bug: #1630672

subject: Fix TypeError being thrown by six.reraise in Engine Package Loader.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-10 21:33:26.000000000', 'files': ['murano/engine/package_loader.py'], 'message': 'Fix TypeError being thrown by six.reraise in Engine Package Loader.

Currently, six.reraise throws a TypeError in Python 3.4, because
it is being called incorrectly in function load_package in
package_loader.ApiPackageLoader.

The way six.reraise is called was changed to reflect the
"generic" way it is called throughout the rest of the file.

Closes-Bug: #1632107

Change-Id: Iadb9c5a6483bf779afd916ebe53852b72581b03e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix TypeError being thrown by six.reraise in Engine Package Loader.

Currently, six.reraise throws a TypeError in Python 3.4, because
it is being called incorrectly in function load_package in
package_loader.ApiPackageLoader.

The way six.reraise is called was changed to reflect the
"generic" way it is called throughout the rest of the file.

Closes-Bug: #1632107

Change-Id: Iadb9c5a6483bf779afd916ebe53852b72581b03e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-11 08:41:00.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/oslo.concurrency/oslo.concurrency.spec.j2'], 'message': 'Try alternative way of blacklisting tests on 32bit platforms

The issue here is that  %ifarch/%ifnoarch do not compare against
the host arch but the build arch, and that is "noarch". We need
to use a slightly different test.

Change-Id: I02c9f4d4bcaf9cb6446e7e7750741ab18c61b94c
(cherry picked from commit 83a43beb7c894060821b2080e2eb118a60da7ba4)

commit_message:
Try alternative way of blacklisting tests on 32bit platforms

The issue here is that  %ifarch/%ifnoarch do not compare against
the host arch but the build arch, and that is "noarch". We need
to use a slightly different test.

Change-Id: I02c9f4d4bcaf9cb6446e7e7750741ab18c61b94c
(cherry picked from commit 83a43beb7c894060821b2080e2eb118a60da7ba4)

removes gnocchi-metricd from the tested pipeline.

is deprecated and will not be used in future.

commit_message:
Enable release notes translation

Releasenote translation publishing is being prepared. 'locale_dirs'
needs to be defined in conf.py to generate translated version of the
release notes.

Note that this repository might not get translated release notes - or
no translations at all - but we add the entry here nevertheless to
prepare for it.

Change-Id: I7c2902f64988c8b39ae8f13fec86622dcc2fb955

commit_message:
A hook which writes hiera datafiles.

This patch creates a hook that writes hiera.yaml and datafiles
to disk. This approach works well for users (like TripleO)
who prefer to maintain Hiera in a more composable manner with
Heat structured config resources rather than specifying all
the Hiera values for each puppet config resource.

Partial-bug: #1596373

Change-Id: I21639f6aadabf9e49f40d1bb0b1d0edcfc4dbc5e

subject: A hook which invokes os-apply-config.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-29 18:47:06.000000000', 'files': ['tests/software_config/test_hook_apply_config.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'hot/software-config/elements/heat-config-apply-config/element-deps', 'hot/software-config/elements/heat-config-apply-config/install.d/50-heat-config-apply-config', 'hot/software-config/elements/heat-config-apply-config/install.d/hook-apply-config.py', 'hot/software-config/elements/heat-config-apply-config/README.rst', 'tests/software_config/test_heat_config.py'], 'message': "A hook which invokes os-apply-config.

The intent is for this element (hook script) to be used in place of the
one in tripleo-image-elements which relies on an external signal handling
shell script at the end of the os-refresh-config run
(99-refresh-completed).

This version will run os-apply-config and return a signal immediately.
Because it uses the heat-hook mechanisms it also supports a broader set of
signal handling capabilities... which 99-refresh-completed doesn't fully
support.

Change-Id: Ic9402ff93cbc840bec1debcd8881de563d03cbf0
"}]
commit_message:
A hook which invokes os-apply-config.

The intent is for this element (hook script) to be used in place of the
one in tripleo-image-elements which relies on an external signal handling
shell script at the end of the os-refresh-config run
(99-refresh-completed).

This version will run os-apply-config and return a signal immediately.
Because it uses the heat-hook mechanisms it also supports a broader set of
signal handling capabilities... which 99-refresh-completed doesn't fully
support.

Change-Id: Ic9402ff93cbc840bec1debcd8881de563d03cbf0

commit_message:
Fix check_config_option_in_central_place

Updated check_config_option_in_central_place. All options with one exception
were moved to central location. Added list that tracks these exceptions.

Also nova/tests should be treated as an exception - there is another check
that validates if config options are not registered in tests.

Closes-Bug: #1613411
Blueprint centralize-config-options-ocata

Change-Id: I802aaf61e711eb4cfa206e4a52e969128dee2189

commit_message:
ENOENT error on '/dev/log'

The nova unit tests recently started to fail on systems where you can't
assume '/dev/log' exists (like mac osx). Patching socket.connect allows
the basic configuration of SysLogHandler('/dev/log') to be tested still.

Change-Id: I2f356ed6d456d6f0ca23b7bbf3943861865ff929
Related-Bug: #1597433

As of now, in most of the test cases, uuidsentinel is used for
generating a UUID except at some places where uuid4() is used.
In order to maintain consistency, we propose to use uuidsentinel
module for generating UUIDs throughout the test cases.

There are some cases where unique UUIDs are required. For such

Change-Id: I00d953c29352a14508cea3a76f22cdd1a16a187a

commit_message:
Replace uuid4() with uuidsentinel

As of now, in most of the test cases, uuidsentinel is used for
generating a UUID except at some places where uuid4() is used.
In order to maintain consistency, we propose to use uuidsentinel
module for generating UUIDs throughout the test cases.

There are some cases where unique UUIDs are required. For such
cases, generate_uuid() from oslo_utils.uuidutils is used.

Change-Id: I00d953c29352a14508cea3a76f22cdd1a16a187a

commit_message:
docs: update code-review guide for config options

We recently came to the conclusion that the original idea how the
config options of Nova should be documented are too hard to maintain.
The discussion can be found on the ML starting with:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-May/095538.html

This change reflects the outcome of the discussion.

Change-Id: I27b2cbb663f3c9a8c2503c3148280a3844f69cdd

option in case of service doesn't stop gracefully in an timely fashion.

Change-Id: I6227fab55b2f4d33611ca3c4bcf01239ff585748

commit_message:
Use Cotyledon oslo config glue

Oslo.service was providing some oslo config configuration.
mainly to print all cfg options on startup and a timeout
option in case of service doesn't stop gracefully in an timely fashion.

It also reload the configuration file on sighup.

This change uses the optional cotyledon helper to do that stuffs.

Change-Id: I6227fab55b2f4d33611ca3c4bcf01239ff585748

subject: Fixes Statistics class create referencing invalid attributes for models.ApiStats.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-05 22:16:10.000000000', 'files': ['murano/db/services/stats.py'], 'message': 'Fixes Statistics class create referencing invalid attributes for
models.ApiStats.

Currently, stats.Statistics.create() erroneously sets 2 incorrect
attributes for an instance of models.ApiStats. These attributes
are:
    1) `stats.request_per_tenant`
    2) `stats.request_per_second`

These attributes have been changed to:
    1) `stats.requests_per_tenant` (plural)
    2) `stats.requests_per_second` (plural)

This change aligns with the currently correct attribute reference:
    - `stats.errors_per_second`

These changes also align with the correct attribute definitions
in models.ApiStats which are: `requests_per_tenant` (plural)
and `requests_per_second` (plural), respectively.

Change-Id: I7c8a0ff2580ee4d5e8f5336425ed1af040a97e8a
Closes-Bug: #1630782
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes Statistics class create referencing invalid attributes for
models.ApiStats.

Currently, stats.Statistics.create() erroneously sets 2 incorrect
attributes for an instance of models.ApiStats. These attributes
are:
    1) `stats.request_per_tenant`
    2) `stats.request_per_second`

These attributes have been changed to:
    1) `stats.requests_per_tenant` (plural)
    2) `stats.requests_per_second` (plural)

This change aligns with the currently correct attribute reference:
    - `stats.errors_per_second`

These changes also align with the correct attribute definitions
in models.ApiStats which are: `requests_per_tenant` (plural)
and `requests_per_second` (plural), respectively.

Change-Id: I7c8a0ff2580ee4d5e8f5336425ed1af040a97e8a
Closes-Bug: #1630782

commit_message:
Cleanup instance device metadata object code

This code was obviously copied from how we did things
with pci requests, e.g. the db_requests parameter.

This change uses a more appropriate parameter name
for device metadata loaded from the database, and
also fixes an alignment nit.

Change-Id: I714fb72ff81d015d02846dbf211e4bcabe76dbf3

commit_message:
prepare Newton release

This change updates our tree for Newton:
- tell "git review" to push in the stable/newton branch.
- configure tox to use the stable/newton upper constraints file
- let tox test UTs with newton release of networking-bagpipe
- let devstack jobs to use newton branch of networking-bagpipe

Change-Id: I67a1103eae0219e5cefa91fd5848aa0b8986c542
Depends-on: I719a9912ba8e7fe87620850017bdda83431e22da

subject: Add limit and marker to QueryParameters class
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-10 13:59:05.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/unit/compute/v2/test_server.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/test_resource2.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/compute/v2/test_image.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/compute/v2/test_server_group.py', 'openstack/resource2.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/compute/v2/test_flavor.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/key_manager/v1/test_secret.py'], 'message': "Add limit and marker to QueryParameters class

After moving to resource2, we've sort of lost the ability to set limits
and markers on list calls while adding query mappings to Resource
subclasses via the QueryParameters class. Every accepted query parameter
must be listed there, so because we didn't have limit and marker in
there, we were only supporting unbounded list requests even though
Resource.list is capable of accepting limit and marker arguments.

This change adds limit and marker into the default mapping since they're
so widely used.

Change-Id: I31901b03974b198af3d7231003d985a1ae54062f
"}]
commit_message:
Add limit and marker to QueryParameters class

After moving to resource2, we've sort of lost the ability to set limits
and markers on list calls while adding query mappings to Resource
subclasses via the QueryParameters class. Every accepted query parameter
must be listed there, so because we didn't have limit and marker in
there, we were only supporting unbounded list requests even though
Resource.list is capable of accepting limit and marker arguments.

This change adds limit and marker into the default mapping since they're
so widely used.

Change-Id: I31901b03974b198af3d7231003d985a1ae54062f

commit_message:
Ensure ceilometermiddleware is installed before swift-proxy on RPM distros

This ensures that if ceilometermiddleware is expected to be used with
swift-proxy, that it is installed before swift-proxy on RPM distributions.
This works around an issue where systemd would start swift-proxy before
everything was ready.

Change-Id: Ide9070807b460a88cd12cf65c3459a295c40f53f

commit_message:
Stop services before yum update for undercloud upgrade

As discussed in the bug below, this change adds a stop for
openstack-* services before the yum update called before the
undercloud install is rerun.

Ultimately the service stop and package update will be handled
by instack-undercloud but this can serve as a workaround until
that lands.

Change-Id: I1934b7a2cb0023832cc2090820a2db83017ea8ee
Closes-Bug: 1632330

subject: Remove reservation from sync power states db filter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-10 14:54:28.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/conductor/manager.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_manager.py'], 'message': "Remove reservation from sync power states db filter

Filter by node reservation for sync power states before iteration
loop doesn't make sense. This patch moves reservation check after
acquire() method (this is more correct, but sucess on upgrade_lock()

Change-Id: I76730506ebf67d7e0872b81e5be5bf49d4eacb4f

commit_message:
Remove reservation from sync power states db filter

Filter by node reservation for sync power states before iteration
loop doesn't make sense. This patch moves reservation check after
acquire() method (this is more correct, but sucess on upgrade_lock()
is not guaranteed). Invalid test_node_locked_on_acquire() fixed.

Change-Id: I76730506ebf67d7e0872b81e5be5bf49d4eacb4f

commit_message:
Allow custom api insecure port

Add custom vars KUBE_API_INSECURE_PORT to allow insecure port to be set
and not hardcoded to 8080

Change-Id: I33111fc868c5917e1f331b35828290e3e9e4373f
Closes-Bug: #1503607

commit_message:
Retrieve Windows VM Password
when the private key is protected with a passphrase
the current implementation can't decrypt the instance
password.
A new passphrase is added to the formulaire and
the jsrsasign lib allow to decrypt the private
key and hence getting the instance password.
Closes-Bug: #1632012

Change-Id: I87cfa8e4737a87eb5ab2b21bbddc1dd40f7a1d57

subject: Ensure that novnc/spice consoles use the public endpoint protocol
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-10 09:16:48.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Ensure that novnc/spice consoles use the public endpoint protocol

When using HTTPS as the public endpoint protocol, the novnc/spice
console endpoint provided must also be HTTPS.

This patch ensures that the novnc/spice console endpoint keys off
the general OpenStack service protocol set for the public endpoints.

It still remains possible to override the endpoint protocol, if
necessary.

Closes-Bug: #1630950
Closes-Bug: #1630953
Change-Id: If3c751adfc4cb74c3230db1c8d4f1c9c3672bea8
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure that novnc/spice consoles use the public endpoint protocol

When using HTTPS as the public endpoint protocol, the novnc/spice
console endpoint provided must also be HTTPS.

This patch ensures that the novnc/spice console endpoint keys off
the general OpenStack service protocol set for the public endpoints.

It still remains possible to override the endpoint protocol, if
necessary.

Closes-Bug: #1630950
Closes-Bug: #1630953
Change-Id: If3c751adfc4cb74c3230db1c8d4f1c9c3672bea8

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-10-11 11:07:45.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/conductor/manager.py', 'ironic/dhcp/neutron.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_manager.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/dhcp/test_neutron.py', 'releasenotes/notes/update-live-port-ee3fa9b77f5d0cf7.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix updating port MAC address for active nodes

Current update fails with HTTP 500 when trying to update a bound Neutron
port. Remove the binding before update and restore it during update.

For nodes in "active" state (or with instance_uuid assigned) only allow
such update in maintenance mode. This is not a breaking change, as previously
it did not work at all.

The cherry-pick has a small modification:
changed neutron.get_client to _build_client as get_client appeared in Newton.

Change-Id: I356fc0eb3702eb16b7f8e675ea416473c65af7e3
Closes-Bug: #1611744
(cherry picked from commit f4ff926ab161297d2281394689ea25a7ef10cbb1)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix updating port MAC address for active nodes

Current update fails with HTTP 500 when trying to update a bound Neutron
port. Remove the binding before update and restore it during update.

For nodes in "active" state (or with instance_uuid assigned) only allow
such update in maintenance mode. This is not a breaking change, as previously
it did not work at all.

The cherry-pick has a small modification:
changed neutron.get_client to _build_client as get_client appeared in Newton.

Change-Id: I356fc0eb3702eb16b7f8e675ea416473c65af7e3
Closes-Bug: #1611744
(cherry picked from commit f4ff926ab161297d2281394689ea25a7ef10cbb1)

subject: Make tox respect upper-constraints.txt
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-11 11:05:44.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Make tox respect upper-constraints.txt

This will force pip install to use the upper-constraints.txt specified
version of pip modules. When you don't do this, you are out on the
bleeding edge and become unstable everytime some python library in the
wide world changes in a way that you don't expect.

Post jobs are not yet compatible with the upper-constraints file, so
override the install_command there to skip upper-constraints.

Blatantly cribbed from the equivalent trove patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/298850

Change-Id: I73aa8cf37adc36db2c56a8f29ea165775a83dc7f

(cherry picked from commit e27e7ed4a9452eb69f6c1af434adb5620706c227)
(cherry picked from commit 6e775b82f4a9b82fdf72f82239d0e8d53add6ba2)
"}]
commit_message:
Make tox respect upper-constraints.txt

This will force pip install to use the upper-constraints.txt specified
version of pip modules. When you don't do this, you are out on the
bleeding edge and become unstable everytime some python library in the
wide world changes in a way that you don't expect.

Post jobs are not yet compatible with the upper-constraints file, so
override the install_command there to skip upper-constraints.

Blatantly cribbed from the equivalent trove patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/298850

Change-Id: I73aa8cf37adc36db2c56a8f29ea165775a83dc7f
Closes-Bug: #1563038
(cherry picked from commit e27e7ed4a9452eb69f6c1af434adb5620706c227)
(cherry picked from commit 6e775b82f4a9b82fdf72f82239d0e8d53add6ba2)

commit_message:
Use CoreOS 1068.10.0

This release contains the following bugfixes:

* Fix timer assertion in systemd (#1308)
* Correct nameserver option parsing in networkd (#1456)
* Fix timer execution calculation in systemd (#1516)
* Improve journald’s resilience to ENOSPC errors (#1522)

version of pip modules. When you don't do this, you are out on the
bleeding edge and become unstable everytime some python library in the
wide world changes in a way that you don't expect.

Post jobs are not yet compatible with the upper-constraints file, so
override the install_command there to skip upper-constraints.

subject: Add the concept of a version map for constraints generation
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-06 05:26:10.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_requirements/cmds/generate.py', 'openstack_requirements/tests/test_generate.py'], 'message': "Add the concept of a version map for constraints generation

We need to generate constraints for all python versions we use.  This is
python 2.7 (trusty and xenial), 3.4 (trusty) and 3.5(xenial).  There
isn't a supportable way to install all 3 versions on a single node.

Add a version-map that allows us to clone the output of a freeze between
python versions.  This assumes that the python version in question are
compatible during the transition window.

It's possible to run with:
    ... --version-map 3.4:3.5 --version-map 3.5:3.4 ...

This will mean that we generate constraints consistently between versions
regardless of which version /usr/bin/python3 is.

Change-Id: I55a3597ea2f2bf48e30dc564a4bf4b2ef7f178b3
"}]
commit_message:
Add the concept of a version map for constraints generation

We need to generate constraints for all python versions we use.  This is
python 2.7 (trusty and xenial), 3.4 (trusty) and 3.5(xenial).  There
isn't a supportable way to install all 3 versions on a single node.

Add a version-map that allows us to clone the output of a freeze between
python versions.  This assumes that the python version in question are
compatible during the transition window.

It's possible to run with:
    ... --version-map 3.4:3.5 --version-map 3.5:3.4 ...

This will mean that we generate constraints consistently between versions
regardless of which version /usr/bin/python3 is.

Change-Id: I55a3597ea2f2bf48e30dc564a4bf4b2ef7f178b3

commit_message:
Update libvirt role to identify flavor correctly

Undercloud libvirt role was picking flavor based un undercloud_node.name
rather than undercloud.flavor. This was never caught because they
happen to be identical (currently).

Closes-Bug: 1630705

Change-Id: I19ab8f1808292833a3fa828874784a6efccce722

commit_message:
implement ability to enable plugin inside of other plugins

implemented the ability to enable plugin inside of other
plugins, for that purpose new method added
fetch_dependency_plugin which will enable additional
plugins. Since it's quite important to fetch plugin
is early as possible new file introduced 'plugin-deps'
where all these dependencies can be described.

Change-Id: If3a3e2a38af85d5c417f537afa13804fb09d8bcf

subject: Ensure that package installs can fall back
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-11 10:58:11.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/install_source.yml'], 'message': "Ensure that package installs can fall back

Currently the package installs only fall back if the pip
installs needed to. During upgrades from environments
where there are the right versions of pip, setuptools
and wheel in the repo, but there aren't yet the right
packages for the package install this method will fail.

This ensures that the fall back install for the packages
is decoupled from the fall back for the pip install.

Change-Id: Id855319bbab5ff6bc3b539ebedc495a5bc12afd1
Closes-Bug: #1627174

commit_message:
Ensure that package installs can fall back

Currently the package installs only fall back if the pip
installs needed to. During upgrades from environments
where there are the right versions of pip, setuptools
and wheel in the repo, but there aren't yet the right
packages for the package install this method will fail.

This ensures that the fall back install for the packages
is decoupled from the fall back for the pip install.

Change-Id: Id855319bbab5ff6bc3b539ebedc495a5bc12afd1
Closes-Bug: #1627174

subject: Using /tmp for SECRET_KEY in tests
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-29 14:44:40.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/test/settings.py'], 'message': "Using /tmp for SECRET_KEY in tests

While using openstack_dashboard/test for the path of SECRET_KEY works
perfectly for building Horizon, including when building the pacakge for
Debian, this is a no-go for Horizon plugins in the Debian context. Indeed,
ironic-ui, manila-ui and sahara-dashboard are all doing:

from openstack_dashboard.test.settings import

While this works in devstack, as it is using a clone of the Horizon git
repository which is writable, it doesn't work in the context of Debian
(or other distro) packaging. Indeed, in this case, the folder becomes
/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/openstack_dashboard/test. This folder,
in all reasonableness, is owned by root, and read only by the user who
is building the package. So at import time, doing this:

SECRET_KEY = secret_key.generate_or_read_from_file(
    os.path.join(TEST_DIR, '.secret_key_store'))

just fails miserably when the horizon plugin packages are building.

Simply using /tmp instead of TEST_DIR fixes the issue. This patch makes
it in a portable way using tempfile.gettempdir() to find /tmp. Though
it isn't completely safe, as the file in /tmp is predictable (and then
there can be a symlink attack), though for unit testing we probably
don't care.

Please allow this patch to go through, so we don't have to carry it
at the distribution level.

Change-Id: Iadf0c2bffe19e2c33083a257102e846886d7680f
"}]
commit_message:
Using /tmp for SECRET_KEY in tests

While using openstack_dashboard/test for the path of SECRET_KEY works
perfectly for building Horizon, including when building the pacakge for
Debian, this is a no-go for Horizon plugins in the Debian context. Indeed,
ironic-ui, manila-ui and sahara-dashboard are all doing:

from openstack_dashboard.test.settings import

While this works in devstack, as it is using a clone of the Horizon git
repository which is writable, it doesn't work in the context of Debian
(or other distro) packaging. Indeed, in this case, the folder becomes
/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/openstack_dashboard/test. This folder,
in all reasonableness, is owned by root, and read only by the user who
is building the package. So at import time, doing this:

SECRET_KEY = secret_key.generate_or_read_from_file(
    os.path.join(TEST_DIR, '.secret_key_store'))

just fails miserably when the horizon plugin packages are building.

Simply using /tmp instead of TEST_DIR fixes the issue. This patch makes
it in a portable way using tempfile.gettempdir() to find /tmp. Though
it isn't completely safe, as the file in /tmp is predictable (and then
there can be a symlink attack), though for unit testing we probably
don't care.

Please allow this patch to go through, so we don't have to carry it
at the distribution level.

Change-Id: Iadf0c2bffe19e2c33083a257102e846886d7680f

subject: Do not stop sync power states on validation error
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 12356, 'name': 'Vladyslav Drok', 'email': 'vdrok@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vdrok'}, {'_account_id': 14629, 'name': 'HPE Proliant', 'email': 'proliantutils@gmail.com', 'username': 'proliantci'}, {'_account_id': 14943, 'name': 'Caio Oliveira', 'email': 'caiobo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br', 'username': 'caiobo'}, {'_account_id': 19339, 'name': 'Dell EMC Ironic CI', 'email': 'openstack-ironic-ci@dell.com', 'username': 'openstack-ironic-ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-10 15:11:00.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/conductor/manager.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_manager.py'], 'message': 'Do not stop sync power states on validation error

"ENROLL" state is excluded from allowed for power states
synchronization, so do_sync_power_state() is not called on such
nodes. The only way to get None power state value in sync-enabled
state is for get_power_state() to start constantly failing, which
will lead to node being put in maintenance. Valid power interface
parameters should be present in "driver_info" before exiting from
maintenance mode. Having it the way it is leads to obscuring the
problem e.g. with bmc credentials.

Change-Id: I7e4ae34d7eacc9223b32954ebfac8e5d1dbcf3d4
'}]
commit_message:
Do not stop sync power states on validation error

"ENROLL" state is excluded from allowed for power states
synchronization, so do_sync_power_state() is not called on such
nodes. The only way to get None power state value in sync-enabled
state is for get_power_state() to start constantly failing, which
will lead to node being put in maintenance. Valid power interface
parameters should be present in "driver_info" before exiting from
maintenance mode. Having it the way it is leads to obscuring the
problem e.g. with bmc credentials.

Change-Id: I7e4ae34d7eacc9223b32954ebfac8e5d1dbcf3d4
